page.title: 01Ornsay - East Coast
page.content: Isle of Ornsay is accessible at low tide from isle of Colonsay and includes on this side a safe anchorage. Archaeological sites include remains of Our Lady's Chapel; Mesolithic shell middens, and a Viking ship-burial. There is an oyster-farm in poll gorm and a group supply of natural winkles, picked in winter for sale in spain. The reefs abound in lobster, velvet crabs and crayfish. The farmland includes a good proportion of arable land and is capable of producing excellent cattle & sheep stock. The area includes one tree, also a curious natural formation "The Elephant's Trunk" - three times around sunwise being a cure for consumption.
